docs.lead_paragraph: Gilad Elbaz has a big mission for Factual, his start-up company: Identify every existing fact to build the world’s chief reference point.

headline.seo: Factual’s Gil Elbaz Wants to Gather the Data Universe
headline.main: Just the Facts. Yes, All of Them.
headline.print_headline: Just the Facts. Yes, All of Them.

docs.abstract: Gilad Elbaz, founder of Factual and 30 other start-ups, may be the most influential inventor in the booming business of data collection and analysis; Factual seeks to collect every fact in the world and then become the chief reference for thousands of connected supercomputing clouds; its statisticians clean and correct data to account for many variables.
docs.snippet: Gilad Elbaz has a big mission for Factual, his start-up company: Identify every existing fact to build the world’s chief reference point.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the film world, Fireman’s Fund has become the go-to company for insuring against production injuries and accidents.

headline.seo: Insuring Hollywood Against Falls (but Not Flops)
headline.main: Insuring Hollywood Against Falls (but Not Flops)
headline.print_headline: Insuring Hollywood Against Falls (but Not Flops)

docs.abstract: Fireman’s Fund Insurance Company is the go-to insurer for the American entertainment industry, insuring against production injuries and accidents, and has carved a lucrative niche for itself in Hollywood and beyond; company insures 80 to 85 percent of all major films produced in the United States and 60 percent of all television reality shows, in addition to some top-grossing music festivals and Billboard top artists.
docs.snippet: In the film world, Fireman’s Fund has become the go-to company for insuring against production injuries and accidents.

docs.lead_paragraph: Unpaid internships, 4 a.m. shifts, a job at the Wawa. What the fate of Drew University’s class of 2011 says about the job market.

headline.seo: What the Fate of One Class of 2011 Says About the Job Market

docs.abstract: Nathaniel Penn article assesses how well the 2011 graduating class of Drew University has done in the job market seven months after graduation.
docs.snippet: Unpaid internships, 4 a.m. shifts, a job at the Wawa. What the fate of Drew University’s class of 2011 says about the job market.

byline.contributor: Additional reporting by Ben Cohen, Rob Fischer, Jacob Savage, Aaron Lake Smith and Connor Southard

docs.lead_paragraph: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. AT 7 years old, Gilad Elbaz wrote, ''I want to be a rich mathematician and very smart.'' That, he figured, would help him ''discover things like time machines, robots and machines that can answer any question.''

headline.main: Just the Facts. Yes, All of Them.

docs.abstract: Gilad Elbaz, founder of Factual and 30 other start-ups, may be the most influential inventor in the booming business of data collection and analysis; Factual seeks to collect every fact in the world and then become the chief reference for thousands of connected supercomputing clouds; its statisticians clean and correct data to account for many variables. Drawing, Photos (L)
docs.snippet: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.     AT 7 years old, Gilad Elbaz wrote, ''I want to be a rich mathematician and very smart.'' That, he figured, would help him ''discover things like time machines, robots and machines that can answer any question.''

docs.lead_paragraph: Donald B. Verrilli Jr., the solicitor general, is known for distilling complex issues into straightforward arguments.

headline.seo: Donald Verrilli, the Lawyer Who Will Defend Obama’s Health Law
headline.main: A Lawyer Who Can Simplify the Complex Draws a Big One: Obama’s Health Overhaul
headline.print_headline: A Lawyer Who Can Simplify the Complex Draws a Big One: Obama’s Health Overhaul

docs.abstract: Donald B Verrilli Jr will go before the Supreme Court to defend the Obama administration's health care overhaul law less than one year after becoming solicitor general; Verrilli is known for being able to marshal his positions in clear and understandable terms.
docs.snippet: Donald B. Verrilli Jr., the solicitor general, is known for distilling complex issues into straightforward arguments.

docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty-six states have questioned whether Congress can force them to make a huge expansion of Medicaid.

headline.seo: Far-Reaching Implications in States’ Health Care Law Challenge
headline.main: Implications Are Far-Reaching in States’ Challenge of Federal Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Implications Are Far-Reaching in States’ Challenge of Federal Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Twenty-six states have questioned whether Congress can force them to make a huge expansion of Medicaid, a major issue in Supreme Court battle over the new health care law; court's decision will have far-reaching implications for both the health care overhaul and Congress's ability to attach conditions to federal grants to states for other purposes.
docs.snippet: Twenty-six states have questioned whether Congress can force them to make a huge expansion of Medicaid.
